description: I would def recommend this to anyone starting out, although it does lack some important features, those are things you don't want in the way when you're first learning anyway.
Well implemented! This software can easily replace Proteus, especially for those just starting out!
This version is out of date (current today is 0.4.13) and is very unstable. The developer has an appimage for download at the website that is much better.

Agree with Vault Dweller. This version is super old, though says was updated recently? Either way, get the v0.4.x package and enjoy. Tried LTSpice, PSpice(?, Ti.com) and some other circuit sim tools only to be blown away by the clunky, mid-nineties feel. This is superior by some orders of magnitude. Having the AVR's in there too takes the cake. Use this; great program and hope it takes off with the Ardweeners.

Ubuntu 21.10, QT libs installed by apt, downloaded "last stable version".
One P-MOSDET, two resistors, a batery and oscilloscope crashed it-

Looks very nice and user-friendly though.
It helped me to check if my school tasks were done correctly
el mejor simulador linux que existe
summary: el mejor simulador linux que existe
